main_definition: A duke is a noble title, ranking above marquess and below prince in the British peerage system, typically given to male members of royal families or those with significant influence.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The head of a duchy (a territory ruled by a duke)
meanings_and_examples.example: Duke William is the current Duke of Normandy, ruling over his duchy.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A person who holds the title or rank of a duke
meanings_and_examples.example: Charles was known as 'The Duke of York' during his lifetime.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An informal term referring to someone perceived as being powerful, influential, or having authority
meanings_and_examples.example: 'He is the duke of this project; he makes all the major decisions.'
